name: symbiont system
description: A mixed system of consisting of two or more organisms (symbionts) in symbiosis (living colocated in time and space): one such symbiont may optionally be identified as a host

name: host-pathogen system
description: A special case of a symbiont system consisting of one symbiont, designated as a host, plus one or more other symbionts acting to create or sustain disease within the host organism

name: microbiome
description: A symbiont system consisting of a collection of (potentially unknown or partially characterized) taxa, where the environment in which the system resides is well-characterized, but the taxonomic composition of the system may be unknown; optionally contains one symbiont specially identified as a host

name: cell line
description: A cell line derived from one or more species or strains

name: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
description: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

name: single organism
description: The organism represented by a subject in the 'single organism' granularity category

name: host
description: Any organism identified as a host for a subject assigned to the 'symbiont system', 'host-pathogen system', or 'microbiome' granularity categories

name: symbiont
description: An organism identified as a symbiont within a subject assigned to the 'symbiont system' granularity category

name: pathogen
description: An organism identified as a pathogen symbiont in a subject assigned to the 'host-pathogen system' granularity category

name: microbiome taxon
description: A constituent taxon of either (a) a subject assigned to the 'environmental microbiome' granularity category or (b) the microbiome (non-host) portion of a subject assigned to the 'host-associated microbiome' granularity category [NB: This role is probably not appropriate for Level 1, because it necessitates the post-facto attachment of downstream analysis procedures (subject -> sample -> library prep -> sequencing -> bioinformatics -> taxonomic classification results) to a subject which was originally uncharacterized at this level]

name: cell line ancestor
description: A taxon identified as a source organism for a subject assigned to the 'cell line' granularity category

name: expression system
description: A biological environment used to produce gene products not native to it: for example, E. coli used to produce custom recombinant proteins
